lines.text:
[Ralph has referred to Princess Anna as a 'fox']
I'm glad you find her so. Best wishes in your fox hunting.
Fox hunting? You like fox hunting, yes.
Well, I don't get out much lately. But I used to go out almost every evening. One club or another.
Really? That often? You must have collected several tails.

[shocked]
Well, I admit I slept with a few. But I'm not like that anymore. Nowadays you can't be too careful. You don't know who they've been with.
No, I suppose not.
Yeah, once I got a steady girl, that put an end to it.
She did not like fox hunting?
Of course not! Anna's not into it, is she?
Oh, yes! She loves it! Most royals do.
It's I who should be thanking you. You showed me how to be a king.
Me? I was a lousy king.
On the contrary. You are a good and decent man, and you've acted honorably. I shall try to follow your example.
Thank you, Ced.
Sir Cedric! Sir Cedric! Good news. We've finally found an heir!
That's wonderful, Duncan. Who is he?
His name is Jones. Ralph Jones.
Is he everything we've hoped for?

[embarrassed]
Well. He has his strengths and his weaknesses. You see, he's
[uncomfortable pause]
American.
Quickly, Duncan! The strengths!
Your majesty, may I present the Sovereign King Mulamboa of Zambezi.

[seeing that the king is black, using a Eubonics dialect]
Hey, homes! Whas happenin'! Gimme quintet, brother!
I do not comprehend, Your Majesty!
Uh, welcome, Your Majesty. On behalf of the people of the United Kingdom...
[uncomfortable silence]
Uh, do you wanna go get a beer?

[after Ralph accuses Graves of undermining him]
This is an OUTRAGE! A VILE piece of slander! I demand to know the source of these allegations!
We have the signed confession of a royal page, Gordon Halliwell, who worked with Lord Graves.
I know NO SUCH MAN!
And several cheques made out to the photographers who took the pictures, signed by Lord Graves. Whose fingerprints were also on the photographs.
So! I saw them at the ball!
And Scotland Yard found the negatives at his house this morning.

[realizes he's been caught]
By what right can you order my arrest!
By the Treason Act of 1702 forbidding interference in the proper succesion of a monarch. Enacted by...
[pause, as he recites the Order of the Kings poem to himself]
William III!

[staggered throughout Parliament as Lord Graves is escorted out by Scotland Yard]
SHAME! SHAME! SHAME! SHAME!

[watching on TV]
That's right! String him up! Wanker!
How's it going, Your Majesty?
Great. We've got nothing in common and she's got a voice like a tuba. If she had her way, we'd have sex on a bed of nails on national television. But at least the party stinks.
[reciting some rules of etiquette to Ralph on videotape]

When in public, a royal personage must refrain from chewing gum, using profanity, picking his nose, scratching his p... p... p... p... private parts and staring down the bust lines of visiting female dignitaries.
What the hell! That's everything!
There's no problem that can't be ignored if we really put our minds to it.

[after Ralph's odd meeting with King Mulamboa]
I think he did pretty well, considering. It could have been much worse!
Yes, he could have exposed himself, I suppose...

[phone rings, he picks it up]
Yes?
[to Cedric]
The Prime Minister for you, sir.

[picks up other phone]
Good afternoon, Prime Minister. Yes... Oh really? Well it's a strange world we live in, sir. Yes, thank you. Good bye.
[hangs up, to Phipps]
The Prime Minister just spoke to King Mulamboa. The King said he couldn't remember when he'd had so much *fun*...
[jumps up, overjoyed]

[almost hugs Phipps, then stops]
Um, sherry?
Yes, please...
Damn, I knew I was getting hosed over here.
Do you feel that being the king of a major nation is tougher than you thought?

Yes, it is difficult sometimes, what with the ceremonial duties and official obligations. But I'm quite pleased with the economic progress my country has made. We are hoping to be the first in Africa to market an automobile!
Oh really? I might be in the market myself soon. The Rolls just doesn't have that much "poop". This car gonna have fuel injection?
Oh yes, everything. Five-speed transmission, rack-and-pin steering...
Reclining buckets? Rear spoiler?
No, but it will get excellent gas mileage.
Gas mileage is fine, but keep in mind - the first question every car buyer asks themselves is 'Will this car get me laid?'

[whispers to Phipps]
Beautifully stated...
It is far easier to whisper advice from cover than to risk it's merit at the point of attack.
We'll put the velour industry on full standby.
It's not enough simply to be the king. You must look and act like one.
